meanings.definition: Cause (an action or process) to begin.
meanings.sent1: By catalyzing the discussion, she helped everyone share their ideas.
meanings.sent2: The coach's pep talk was catalyzing the team's motivation to win the game.
meanings.sent3: The birthday cake was catalyzing excitement among the children at the party.
meanings.sent4: His innovative idea was catalyzing a wave of creativity in the office.
meanings.sent5: The alarm clock's loud ring was catalyzing everyone to wake up and start the day.

meanings.definition: Speed up the rate of a chemical reaction.
meanings.sent1: The catalyst was catalyzing the reaction, making it finish faster.
meanings.sent2: Adding heat to the mixture was catalyzing the chemical reaction in the lab.
meanings.sent3: The scientist's dancing was catalyzing the reaction in a comical way.
meanings.sent4: The new ingredient was catalyzing the reaction like a bolt of lightning.
meanings.sent5: The catalyst was catalyzing the reaction as if it had superpowers.

meanings.sent1: Her presence was catalyzing positive change in the community.
meanings.sent2: The new law was catalyzing innovation in the industry.
meanings.sent3: The clown's performance was catalyzing laughter among the audience.
meanings.sent4: The music was catalyzing memories of their first dance together.
meanings.sent5: The leader's speech was catalyzing unity among the team members.
